prompt: <description>Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0492, 0.0] For the first face of the prism (face_1), create loops as follows: - Loop_1: - Line_1: [0.0, 0.0246] to [0.0369, 0.0246] - Line_2: [0.0369, 0.0246] to [0.0369, 0.12] - Line_3: [0.0369, 0.12] to [0.0861, 0.12] - Line_4: [0.0861, 0.12] to [0.0861, 0.1446] - Line_5: [0.0861, 0.1446] to [0.0, 0.1446] - Line_6: [0.0, 0.1446] to [0.0, 0.0246] This loop forms the upper surface of the prism. Next, create a circular loop (Loop_2) as follows: - Circle_1: Center at [0.0184, 0.0615], Radius: 0.0086 This loop forms the circular hole in the top surface of the prism. For face_2 (the bottom surface), create a loop that follows the outline of the prism without the hole in its center (omitting the circular loop_2). Next, set the scaling parameter for sketch_scale of part 1 as 0.75, extrude_depth_towards_normal as 0.0106, and create a new body feature with no boolean operation applied to add materials to previous models. The height of part 1 (the rectangular prism) is 0.0106, and its width and length are 0.75. The overall dimensions of the prism are approximately 2:1 in height and width. The diameter of the cylindrical hole is approximately half the height of the prism.</description>
